intro: Trachymene billardierei var. crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved false daisy, is a herbaceous perennial native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the genus Trachymene. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or open habitats.
